meanings.definition: Exhibiting more than one form or shape.
meanings.sent1: The artist created a pleomorphic sculpture with various shapes and sizes.
meanings.sent2: The clouds in the sky looked pleomorphic, constantly changing their forms.
meanings.sent3: The pleomorphic cake had layers of different shapes, surprising everyone at the party.
meanings.sent4: Her thoughts were pleomorphic, shifting from one idea to another like a kaleidoscope.
meanings.sent5: The garden was filled with pleomorphic flowers, each petal a different shape and color.

meanings.definition: Having the ability to change or vary in form.
meanings.sent1: The material was pleomorphic, easily molding into different shapes.
meanings.sent2: The chameleon's pleomorphic skin allowed it to blend into its surroundings.
meanings.sent3: The pleomorphic toy transformed into various animals, delighting the children.
meanings.sent4: His mood was pleomorphic, shifting from happiness to sadness in an instant.
meanings.sent5: The landscape was pleomorphic, altering its appearance with the changing seasons.

meanings.definition: Describing a cell or organism that can take on different shapes or sizes.
meanings.sent1: The pleomorphic bacteria could change shapes to evade antibiotics.
meanings.sent2: The amoeba was pleomorphic, adapting its form to different environments.
meanings.sent3: The pleomorphic virus played hide and seek with the immune system.
meanings.sent4: Her imagination was pleomorphic, creating worlds of varying sizes and shapes.
meanings.sent5: The creature in the story was pleomorphic, shifting its appearance to confuse its enemies.
